visualization_prompt: Generate a bar chart showing renewable energy adoption percentages across technologies using comparative categorical analysis
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two-dimensional categorical/numerical data comparing 10 renewable energy technologies. Synthetic percentages (μ=10.0%, σ=10.2) follow a right-skewed distribution reflecting real-world adoption patterns, with a validation sum of 100% across categories. Projection data shows calculated growth trajectories maintaining proportional relationships. The bar-line combination maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines while maintaining Cairo's proportional ink principle through coordinated color coding. The dual-axis presentation follows Tufte's layering concept, using bar opacity (80%) and line markers to create visual hierarchy. Statistical anchors include quartile distribution in current adoption (Q1=1.2%, Q3=12.3%) and 18.7% CAGR in projection data.
